JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Staff scientist in Archaeology/Zooarchaeology at Globe Institute
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
We are looking for a highly motivated and independent staff scientist for a limited period of 6 month to support our efforts in archaeology/zooarchaeology, to commence 16 June 2022.

Your job
The position includes working as a zooarchaeologist with the ArchaeoScience Unit, which advises and carries out scientific analysis for the archaeological museums in Denmark. Furthermore, the position includes a research component on faunal materials from Greenlandic sites focussed on resource utilisation and with a special emphasis on preservation issues and taphonomic pathways. The right applicant therefore has a strong track-record in the analysis and publication of faunal remains, including the ability to carry out research and contribute to published and unpublished reports on materials from Denmark and Greenland. The successful candidate must demonstrate a strong commitment to continue the development of the ArchaeoScience Unit, as well as develop a personal research profile.

You will be expected to support the researchers in their ongoing research project Activating Arctic Heritage - Exploring Unesco World Heritage in Greenland hosted by the National Museums of Greenland and Denmark.

The position includes communication, oral and written, with various Danish museums that the ArchaeoScience unit cooperates with and as such fluent written and spoken Danish is a must.

Profile
We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic staff scientist with the following competencies and experience:

Essential experience and skills:

  • You have a PhD in Archaeology/Zooarchaeology or related
  • Relevant experience in identifying fish and bird remains
  • You have documented research experience in Zooarchaeological analysis
  • You have experience with fauna from Denmark and Greenland
  • Good English skills, written and spoken
  • Fluent Danish skills, written and spoken
Desirable experience and skills:

  • Knowledge of carrying out scientific analysis on archaeological materials according to the guidelines of the Danish Ministry of Culture (Museumsloven, kap. 8)
  • You have experience in communication and advising archaeologists and museums on the various scientific analysis available to archaeology today

Place of employment
The place of employment is at Globe Institute, University of Copenhagen. We offer creative and stimulating working conditions in dynamic and international research environment.

Terms of salary and employment
The employment as special consultant (specialkonsulent) is a fulltime limited position. Starting date is June 16th and will terminate without further notice by November 2022. Employment will be in accordance with the provisions of the collective agreement between the Danish Ministry of Finance and AC (the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations). The monthly salary will be based on the number of years of work experience (seniority) with the possibility to negotiate a salary supplement based on prior experiences and qualifications. The employer will pay an additional 17.1 % to your pension fund.

Questions
For further information regarding the position, please contact Kurt Kjær; kurtk@sund.ku.dk

Application
Your application should in [English/Danish] include:

  • Letter of application addressing the requirements (max. one page).
  • Curriculum Vitae
  • A certified/signed copy of certificate(s) of education
Please submit your application by clicking on “Apply Now” below. Only online applications will be accepted.

Application deadline: 9 May 2022, 23.59 CET
We reserve the right not to consider material received after the deadline, and not to consider applications that do not live up to the abovementioned requirements.

Interviews are expected to be held shortly after the deadline.

The University of Copenhagen wishes to reflect the diversity of society and welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.
